article.headline: Seton Hall 77, Providence 74
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Kelly Whitney scored a game-high 20 points as Seton Hall won its fourth consecutive game, 77-74 over Providence on Wednesday night. The game featured eight ties and 17 lead changes, including six lead changes on six straight possessions in the final three minutes. Donald Copeland, who scored seven of the Pirates' final 12 points, scored on a left-handed layup with 1:32 to play to give Seton Hall (13-6, 4-3 Big East) the lead for good. Grant Billmeier made two free throws with 7.4 seconds left. The Friars had three chances to tie or go ahead in the final moments, but missed all three shots, including a 3-point attempt by Sharaud Curry at the buzzer. Herbert Hill led the Friars (9-10, 2-6) with 14 points on 7-of-10 shooting. Donnie McGrath finished with 11 points and helped bring the Friars back from a 5-point deficit, scoring on successive drives to put them ahead 64-62 with 5:15 left. Curry had 10 of his 13 points in the first half to spark the Friars to a 37-32 halftime lead. Jamar Nutter added 15 for the Pirates.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
